## Fixes Applied

I've addressed all the issues you reported:

### 1. Control hints removed from other levels ‚úÖ
- Removed `InstructionsLabel` from `scenes/levels/TestTier.tscn`
- Removed `InstructionsLabel` from `scenes/levels/BuildingLevel.tscn`
- Removed the code that was updating these labels from `test_tier.gd` and `building_level.gd`

### 2. Ammo count added to tutorial level ‚úÖ
- Added `AmmoLabel` to `scenes/levels/csharp/TestTier.tscn`
- Added ammo tracking functionality to `tutorial_level.gd` (same as other levels)
- Supports both C# Player (via `AmmoChanged` signal) and GDScript Player

### 3. Fixed tutorial prompts not appearing in compiled exe ‚úÖ
The issue was with the screen position calculation. The original code used:
```gdscript
var camera := get_viewport().get_camera_2d()
var screen_pos := _player.global_position - camera.global_position + get_viewport().size / 2.0
```

This doesn't work correctly in exported builds due to viewport size differences. Fixed to use:
```gdscript
var canvas_transform: Transform2D = get_viewport().get_canvas_transform()
var screen_pos: Vector2 = canvas_transform * _player.global_position
```

This uses Godot's built-in canvas transform which correctly converts world coordinates to screen coordinates in both editor and exported builds.

### Case Study
I also created a case study document at `docs/case-studies/issue-139/README.md` with:
- Timeline of events
- Root cause analysis for each issue
- Technical insights
- Complete solution draft log from the initial implementation

Please test the compiled exe again to verify the fixes work correctly!
